alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, Randolph, northwestern Calhoun, north central Early, Quitman and Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/... At 222 PM EDT/122 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Weston to near Fort Gaines. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Morgan, Dawson, Cuthbert, Edison, Shellman, Bronwood, Parrott, Bellville, Bluffton, Shorterville, Wire Bridge, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan and Dawson Municipal A/P. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Clay; Early; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell
